verses.text: Better \add is\add* a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, Than a house full \add of\add* sacrifices with strife.
A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, And shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
The fining pot \add is\add* for silver, and the furnace for gold: But the \sc Lord\sc* trieth the hearts.
A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; \add And\add* a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: \add And\add* he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
Childrenâ€™s children \add are\add* the crown of old men; And the glory of children \add are\add* their fathers.
Excellent speech becometh not a fool: Much less do lying lips a prince.
A gift \add is as\add* a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; But he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
A reproof entereth more into a wise \add man\add* Than an hundred stripes into a fool.
An evil \add man\add* seeketh only rebellion: Therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
\add Let\add* a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, Rather than a fool in his folly.
Whoso rewardeth evil for good, Evil shall not depart from his house.
The beginning of strife \add is as\add* when one letteth out water: Therefore leave off contention, before \add it\add* be meddled with.
He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, Even they both \add are\add* abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*.
Wherefore \add is there\add* a price in the hand of a fool To get wisdom, seeing \add he hath\add* no heart \add to it?\add*
A friend loveth at all times, And a brother is born for adversity.
A man void of understanding striketh hands, \add And\add* becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
He loveth transgression that loveth strife: \add And\add* he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: And he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
He that begetteth a fool \add doeth it\add* to his sorrow: And the father of a fool hath no joy.
A merry heart doeth good \add like\add* a medicine: But a broken spirit drieth the bones.
A wicked \add man\add* taketh a gift out of the bosom To pervert the ways of judgment.
Wisdom \add is\add* before him that hath understanding; But the eyes of a fool \add are\add* in the ends of the earth.
A foolish son \add is\add* a grief to his father, And bitterness to her that bare him.
Also to punish the just \add is\add* not good, \add Nor\add* to strike princes for equity.
He that hath knowledge spareth his words: \add And\add* a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: \add And\add* he that shutteth his lips \add is esteemed a man\add* of understanding.
